page.title: 04Transport and Fishing
page.content: The{River Ouse}is a tidal river. The River Ouse today affects the life of the villages very little. It is a barrier rather than a water highway.However numerous cargo boats carry goods to the Flour Mills and Animal Food Mills at Selby and Barlby.The River is bridged at Goole and at Selby where the notorious Toll Bridge gives precedence to river traffic and consequential delays to road users. Pleasure craft use the river particularly in the summer months and many small boats use the river to visit the pictuesque city of York. Beside the Ouse at Newhay is situated {"Newhay Fisheries".}A flood of the Ouse left land under water. The residue made excellent carp ponds. The table carp reared here are sold throughout the country.
